title: How does artificial selection disrupt natural selection? - Quora

response.answer_text: Great first two answers. The underlying fact is that “artificial” is homo sapiens doing a self-reference. Evolution responds each time progeny arrive. Some make it, some don’t. It doesn’t go beyond that. Human influence is far more finicky and irrational than Mother Nature, so things can happen in a hurry. An not always for the good, sheep and turkeys being great examples because neither one is smart enough, any more, to survive in the wild.

It doesn't artifical selection is just a very strong selection preassure being applied to one group of organisms by another group of organisms. Other selection pressures will still also apply. Organisms exert selection pressures on each other both directly and indirectly all the time. A lot of an organisms environment is after all other organisms.
